org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.NFS.RobotComponents

Class TimedAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.NFS.RobotComponents.TimedAction

  • public class TimedAction
extends java.lang.Object
    Too many people use sleep(...) where it doesn't need to be. This is a simple util that runs an action until a time is reached and then performs a specified stop action. This is basically the same as a chain of commands with a deadline WaitCommand but without command-based.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimedAction(java.lang.Runnable onRun, java.lang.Runnable onEnd, double milliseconds)
      Sets up an asymmetric timed action.
      TimedAction(java.lang.Runnable onRun, java.lang.Runnable onEnd, double milliseconds, boolean symmetric)
      Sets up a timed action that runs two actions depending on the time and is non-blocking.
      TimedAction(java.lang.Runnable onRun, java.lang.Runnable onEnd, double runTime, double endTime) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void reset()
      Resets the timed action to the RUNNING state
      void run()
      Runs the timed action in a non-blocking FSM

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimedAction

        public TimedAction(java.lang.Runnable onRun,
                   java.lang.Runnable onEnd,
                   double milliseconds)
        Sets up an asymmetric timed action.
        Parameters:
        onRun - the action to run during the time period
        onEnd - the action to run after the time period is up
        milliseconds - the wait time

      • TimedAction

        public TimedAction(java.lang.Runnable onRun,
                   java.lang.Runnable onEnd,
                   double milliseconds,
                   boolean symmetric)
        Sets up a timed action that runs two actions depending on the time and is non-blocking.
        Parameters:
        onRun - the action to run during the time period
        onEnd - the action to run after the time period is up
        milliseconds - the wait time
        symmetric - true if the timed action runs symmetric

      • TimedAction

                   java.lang.Runnable onEnd,
                   double runTime,
                   double endTime)

      • running

        public boolean running()
        Returns:
        true if the timed action is currently running
